hints.content:
We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}7$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}63\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}9$ groups of $\color{purple}7$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}7} + \color{purple}7\color{black} + \color{purple}7\color{black} + \color{purple}7\color{black}+ \color{purple}7\color{black} + \color{purple}7\color{black} + \color{purple}7\color{black}+ \color{purple}7\color{black} + \color{purple}7}}_{\color{blue}9}\color{purple}\text{ sevens}}} = \color{green}63}$

$\color{blue}9\times 7~=63$
$63\div\color{blue}9=7$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}5$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}35\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}7$ groups of $\color{purple}5$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}5} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}+ \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}}_{\color{blue}7}\color{purple}\text{ fives}}} = \color{green}35}$

$\color{blue}7\times 5~=35$
$35\div\color{blue}7=5$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
If we have $\color{blue}4$ groups, how many would need to be in each group to make a total of $\color{green}16\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}4$ groups of $\color{purple}4$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}4} + \color{purple}4\color{black} + \color{purple}4\color{black} + \color{purple}4\color{black}\color{black}_{\color{blue}4}\color{purple}\text{ fours}}} = \color{green}16}$

$4\times  \color{purple}4~=16$
$16\div4=\color{purple}4$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
If we have $\color{blue}3$ groups of $\color{purple}8$, how many total do we have?

There are $\color{green}24\color{black}$ total.$\underbrace{\color{purple}8} + \color{purple}8\color{black} + \color{purple}8\color{black}\color{black}_{\color{blue}3}\color{purple}\text{ eights}}} = \color{green}24}$

$3\times 8~=\color{green}24\color{black}$
$\color{green}24\color{black}\div8=3$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
If we have $\color{blue}3$ groups of $\color{purple}8$, how many total do we have?

There are $\color{green}24\color{black}$ total.$\underbrace{\color{purple}8} + \color{purple}8\color{black} + \color{purple}8\color{black}\color{black}_{\color{blue}3}\color{purple}\text{ eights}}} = \color{green}24}$

$3\times 8~=\color{green}24\color{black}$
$\color{green}24\color{black}\div8=3$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
If we have $\color{blue}6$ groups, how many would need to be in each group to make a total of $\color{green}30\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}6$ groups of $\color{purple}5$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}5} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}+\color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}\color{black}_{\color{blue}6}\color{purple}\text{ fives}}} = \color{green}30}$

$6\times  \color{purple}5~=30$
$30\div6=\color{purple}5$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}6$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}48\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}8$ groups of $\color{purple}6$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}6} + \color{purple}6\color{black} + \color{purple}6\color{black} + \color{purple}6\color{black}+\color{purple}6\color{black} + \color{purple}6\color{black} + \color{purple}6\color{black} + \color{purple}6}}_{\color{blue}8}\color{purple}\text{ sixes}}} = \color{green}48}$
$\color{green}48\color{black}\div\color{purple}6\color{black} = \fbox{\color{blue}8}\color{black}$ $~~$ because  $~~$ $\fbox{\color{blue}8}\times\color{purple}6=\color{green}48}$.

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}3$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}3\color{black}$?
There is $\color{blue}1$ group of $\color{purple}3$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}3}\color{black}_{\color{blue}1}\color{purple}\text{ three}\color{black}} = \color{green}3}$

$\color{blue}1\times 3~=3$
$3\div\color{blue}1=3$

We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{blue}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{blue}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}5$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}35\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}7$ groups of $\color{purple}5$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}5} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}+ \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}}_{\color{blue}7}\color{purple}\text{ fives}}} = \color{green}35}$

$\color{blue}7\times 5~=35$
$35\div\color{blue}7=5$
